intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. pentameres, commonly known as the five-lobed buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, yellow flowers with five distinct lobes, which are often accompanied by a bright orange center. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are typically hairy beneath. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ornamental addition to gardens and natural habitats.
